Articles.Content:
Hi @linuxgurugamer

it seems I found incompatibility between VVC  and the new version of scatterer (0.06).

with the previous version of the scatterter, the raster prop monitor displayed an vessel image, but with the new one there is none (blackscreen)

i dont know why, but it is scatterer (i run game 5 times, install old and new scatterer)

 

--------

also i post pics here - scatterer page 

EDIT: fixed in scatterer last version of .dll

Edited April 24, 2020 by *MajorTom*

.

Edited May 22, 2020 by One eyed Smile

Hi @linuxgurugamer

Is there any way to change the default latency setting in this mod? Everytime I turn vessel viewer on my game drop to 10fps from 50fps and start stuttering. It Runs better when i change the latency mod to obscene or high. And its frustrating to change the latency everytime i play.

2 hours ago, One eyed Smile said:

Hi @linuxgurugamer

Is there any way to change the default latency setting in this mod? Everytime I turn vessel viewer on my game drop to 10fps from 50fps and start stuttering. It Runs better when i change the latency mod to obscene or high. And its frustrating to change the latency everytime i play.

Not at the present time, sorry
maybe i'm being just dumb but it seems to be glitched, every now and then there appears a new "disco mode" button and now the config window is super long, am i doing something or is it a bug?

Hi, I've got some issues with this mod.

Problem: I use DE_IVA (With RasterPropMonitor of course), and it worked fine for a while, but then for some mysterious reason it stopped working, as in when I selected the monitor mode of VV on DE_IVA, it was blank. Everything else worked, but the VV monitor mode was black apart from the side controls, which didn't change anything. I reinstalled VV, and then everything in DE_IVA was blank - the buttons were blank and unresponsive, lights were dark, monitors were black, etc.  

My troubleshooting steps and results:

1. I first tried to remove the merged files from VV in the JSI folder. DE_IVA worked, but when I selected VV mode, it said VV was not installed.

2. I tried to systematically add and remove files based on whether it worked or not. I found out that the "license.md" file was causing trouble. When I removed it and then selected VV, nothing happened, but the monitor I selected it on would become unresponsive, unless I quicksaved and quickloaded. 

Is there a way to fix this? Thanks!

9 hours ago, Kev1n8088 said:

I'm having almost the same problem. Everything is fully installed and in the RPM shows that vessel viewer is not installed. Someone with the same problem?

For both of you, no log file, no support.  See my signature for more info

For both of you, no log file, no support.  See my signature for more info

@linuxgurugamer Don`t worry, already solved. The problem was the toolbar addon not properly installed. And by the way, thanks for your huge efforts on KSP Comunity.

For both of you, no log file, no support.  See my signature for more info

Solved it! Seems like some stuff was not installed correctly (I put a gamedata folder into the gamedata folder LOL)

Glad you two fixed your issues but mines still not working.

Same sort of issue where I click the VesselVIew button during IVA, I get a black screen and that monitor is effectively frozen until I reload.

Player.log:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JrhNmA9iNA78A14VhP-feGRw_4x6mxtx/view?usp=sharing

On a side note, the main post for the topic advertises RPM-only version but there was none on GitHub.

Glad you two fixed your issues but mines still not working.

Same sort of issue where I click the VesselVIew button during IVA, I get a black screen and that monitor is effectively frozen until I reload.

Player.log:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JrhNmA9iNA78A14VhP-feGRw_4x6mxtx/view?usp=sharing

On a side note, the main post for the topic advertises RPM-only version but there was none on GitHub.

Had this problem too, I fixed it by installing the subfolder JSI/RPMBundles despite the fact that the .assetbundle files are already withing JSI/RasterPropMonitor. Problem occurs because VesselViewer doesn't know where to access the files bc it is looking for JSI/RPMBundles folder. Don't know if that'll fix it for you but your bug sounds like mine and this fixed it for me.

15 minutes ago, Iodyne said:

Had this problem too, I fixed it by installing the subfolder JSI/RPMBundles despite the fact that the .assetbundle files are already withing JSI/RasterPropMonitor. Problem occurs because VesselViewer doesn't know where to access the files bc it is looking for JSI/RPMBundles folder. Don't know if that'll fix it for you but your bug sounds like mine and this fixed it for me.

yeah.. you *have* to ovwerwrite any existing JSI folder in GameData, with the one included with VessleViewer... it contains JSI Part Utilites... basically a seperate mod from the RasterProp included in *its*JSI* folder...
Does this work with 1.10?

I can’t seem to properly install this with RPM adopted, it gives me a JSI and vesselviewer folder and I don’t know what to do with it.. I put the vesselviewer folder in and that broke all my monitors so I couldn’t use them for some reason.. (don’t have logs yet, will get them soon.)

Doesn't work with 1.11.1  seems to work, might be glitchy.

Edited February 25, 2021 by PyjackMeat
This one is the mod of mine that is most likely to need a recompile, since it deals with shaders and things that can change between game versions.  I'll get to it when I can.
Having issues with Waterfall FX. The plume appears as a giant blob.
is there a 0.8.8.3 RPM only version?

Seems to be working in 1.11.1 with RPM. Only thing I've run into that is a hinderance is if I interact with a part via the Custom Display Modes > Part Selector, everything works fine, but for some reason the next time I open the menu it will have an additional entry for the "Part Selector" menu. No idea why. It will be there for all future uses of VV, even in other craft.

Also, it would be really convenient if somehow it remembered what orientation you had the VV in so you don't have to reset it after every EVA.

Edited May 1, 2021 by Wookyskill
